column8:
Check-In: Please check in at least 30 minutes prior to the departure time for the train-only booking. If you are cruising on the Interislander Ferry, please check in at least 45 minutes prior to your departure. Upon check-in, you will receive your boarding pass with your seat and carriage numbers on it. 

 

Seat Allocations:  At check-in, on your day of travel, you will receive a boarding pass with your carriage and seat allocation. All carriages include airline-styled paired seating and seating around tables. Families and group bookings are allocated table seating wherever possible. Online seat selection is not currently available, but if you have a specific seating request or wish to seat separate bookings together, please email us with your booking reference(s) and we will do our best to accommodate your requests.

 

Face Mask: Face masks are no longer mandatory, however, we do recommend customers use face masks when moving about the train. The onboard crew will continue to wear face masks for the time being

 

 

 

Carry On items: To maximize scenic views and natural light coming through our glass shelves and skylights, we ask all passengers to keep their belongings to a minimum.  Carry-on baggage should be limited to a jacket and a small bag or handbag. All wheeled cabin bags must be checked in. 

 

Checked Luggage: Each Scenic Class passenger fare includes the following allowance: 

1 x Large checked bag or suitcase maximum weight of 23kgs, maximum volume* of 158 linear cm (62”). 

1 x Cabin bag, wheeled and/or hard-sided suitcases must be Checked in (cannot be taken aboard), a maximum weight of 7kgs, maximum volume* for the cabin bag is 118 linear cm (46.5”). 

1 x Small bag or handbag: for taking important personal items aboard, including any fragile or perishable items, money, jewelry, and valuables. 

1 x Small infant bag: if you have an infant with you, you may bring an additional small bag for the journey.

Please note: infants do not get any luggage allowance.

 

Oversized Luggage: When the length, width, and height of your bag add up to more than 158cm ( 62 inches ) or 118cm ( 46.5 inches ) you can buy a re-pack bag for $20 to repack your luggage to allowable dimensions. This $35 cost is additional to the excess luggage charge.

 

Delays

 

Onboard Purchases: It is a good idea to carry cash on board the train should you want refreshments. The train goes out of cellphone coverage for a lot of the trip so using EFTPOS/credit cards on board is not always possible.

  

 

 

""

Check In: You should be at your stop at least 20 minutes before departure, and report to the driver before boarding.Label all checked luggage with your name and FINAL destination. Your bus may have different signage or branding for operational reasons.

 


Carry On items: For safety reasons, each passenger is allowed 1 carry on luggage or item not exceeding 5kgs (11 pounds) into the carriages. Passengers are fully responsible for their carry on item/s. The operator of the bus service is not responsible for any loss or damage to any personal carry on item/s.

 


Checked Luggage:  Maximum one medium-size bag/suitcase (max 20kg) per person. Each item must be no more than 158 linear cm (height plus length plus width – 62 inches). Bicycles presented in this fashion will be counted as one of your two checked luggage. Bikes must be collapsed down with both wheels removed from the frame. Please contact Intercity in advance to advise you are travelling with a bike as not all services can accommodate bikes due to space reasons

""

Check-In:
Please check in at least 60 minutes prior to your departure time if you are walking on the ferry, if you are taking a vehicle onboard, please check in at least 1.30 Hours prior to your departure time. 

 

Interislander advises passengers that the Picton Vehicle Check-in area is on Auckland St, 200 meters before the passenger terminal. Look for the blue entrance lane when approaching the terminal.

 

Carry On items:

For safety reasons, each passenger is allowed 1 carry-on luggage or item not exceeding 5kgs (11 pounds) into the carriages. Passengers are fully responsible for their carry-on item/s. The operator of the train service is not responsible for any loss or damage to any personal carry-on item/s.

 

Checked Luggage:

Free checked luggage allowance is limited to 2 pieces of luggage per passenger and not exceeding 20kgs (44 pounds) per item of all coach, train, and ferry services. Each item must be no more than 200 linear cm (height plus length plus width – approx. 6.5 linear feet).

""

Reservations need to be made by emailing us at info@newzealandtravelteam.com. 

Reservations must be made 72hrs prior to travel and are subject to availability, if you turn up without a seat reservation you may be denied boarding.

 

All bookings, amendments, or cancellations must be made at least 72 hours before departure time for bus/coach/train/ferry travel.

Cancellation of any travel sector/s must be made 72 hours before departure time and the unused time will be credited back to your Pass.

Your Pass is non-refundable once travel sectors have been booked and confirmed. 

Your Pass does not include any bus/coach travel on local suburban bus services in New Zealand's major centers or any airport-to-city bus services.

Your Pass is refundable less $100 per person if no sector/itinerary has been booked and confirmed.

 

New Zealand Rail Passes/ Bus Passes / RailBus Passes are valid for 1 or 2 months from the date of the first travel date depending on the pass purchased.

 

Check-In: Please check in at least 20 Minutes prior to the departure time. Upon check-in, you will receive your boarding pass with your seat and carriage numbers on it. 

 

Carry On items: For safety reasons, each passenger is allowed 1 carry-on luggage or item not exceeding 5kgs (11 pounds) into the carriages. Passengers are fully responsible for their carry-on item/s. The operator of the train service is not responsible for any loss or damage to any personal carry-on item/s. 

 

Checked Luggage: Free checked luggage allowance is 1 item per person, with a maximum weight of 32kgs. Bags weighing over 23 kg will require two crew members to lift onto the train, you may be asked for assistance.  Wheeled cabin bags and backpacks are classed as check-in luggage.  Two additional items of baggage can be purchased for $20 including GST per piece. 

 

Seat Allocations:  At check-in on your day of travel you will receive a boarding pass with your carriage and seat allocation. All carriages include airline-styled paired seating and seating around tables. Families and group bookings are allocated table seating wherever possible. Online seat selection is not currently available, but if you have a specific seating request or wish to seat separate bookings together, please email us with your booking reference(s) and we will do our best to accommodate your requests. 

""

Travel amendments can be made up to 24 hours before departure date. Cancellations can be made up to 24 hours before departure date with 100% refund. An additional NZ$50.00 Refund Processing Fee will also be imposed. Less than 24 hours and after the time of departure, amendments and refunds are not permitted. Travel Agent cancellation/refund fee/s may apply. To amend or cancel a reservation please call RailBus New Zealand Travel Centre on 0800-143-669 tollfree within New Zealand, Monday to Friday 9.00am to 5.00pm""

""

Fare is refundable less a 10% processing fee for cancellations prior to 72 hours before departure, within 72 hours fares are nonrefundable.
Subject to availability, you can change sailings, provided you advise us 72 hours prior to your departure. No refunds or changes are allowed after your final check-in time.

 

To amend or cancel a reservation, please email our New Zealand Travel Team at  info@newzealandtravelteam.com 72 hours or 3 days before the travel date.

 

Check-In:

Please check in at least 45 minutes prior to your departure time if you are walking on the ferry, if you are taking a vehicle onboard, please check in at least 1 Hour prior to your departure time.

All passengers over 18 years of age are required to present a valid form of identification when checking in eg driver's license or passport


Luggage:

Small hand baggage can be taken on board. Larger baggage, including backpacks, must be checked in. Except for Sporting Equipment (refer below), we will not accept individual baggage items, that exceed 23 kilograms in weight or 200 linear centimeters (height + length + width) in dimension. For safety reasons, there are no exceptions to the weight restriction. The luggage allowance is two (2) items of baggage per person. Additional baggage items in excess of this may be conveyed subject to availability, and weight and size limitations. Additional items will incur an additional charge.

 

Oversized Sporting Equipment, including Bicycles:

Sporting Equipment, including Bicycles, such as surfboards, golf clubs, and canoes, will be carried subject to an additional payment. Additional conditions apply to firearms.

 

Service Delays, Changes, or Cancellations

Departure times are not guaranteed and schedules are subject to change. Interislander will not be liable for any loss suffered as a result of a cancellation or a service departing/arriving before or after the scheduled time.

 

Vehicles

Interislander may reassess at check-in the classification ( type, width, length, or weight ) of any vehicle, and changes may be made to the fare charged. Any increase in fare must be paid before the vehicle is loaded

Vehicles will not be carried unless accompanied by a driver. Trailers or caravans will not be carried unless towed by another vehicle.

Carriage of a vehicle may be refused if Interislander considers it to be insecurely loaded, or otherwise unsafe for carriage

 

Accessibility

Every effort is made to ensure your safety and comfort. Please advise in advance if assistance is required when you book. Each ship has different accessibility characteristics so please enquire if you need further details.

 

Limited Liability

Please be aware that the liability to you for any loss or damage is capped at $2000 for each unit of goods lost or damaged. We recommend that passengers hold their own insurance. Any claims must be received within 30 days of the date traveled on the relevant service.

""

The fare booked is subject to the Terms and Conditions of your service provider along with the Terms and Conditions acknowledged when your booking was confirmed. 

 

Fare is 100% refundable less a 10% processing fee up to 48 hours prior to departure, inside of 48 hours fares are non-refundable. An additional fare may be charged, depending on availability.

 

Subject to availability, you can change sailings, provided you advise us 48 hours prior to your departure. No refunds or changes are allowed after your final check-in time.

 

Check-In:

Please check-in at least 45 minutes prior to your departure time if you are walking on the ferry, if you are taking a vehicle onboard, please check in at least 1 Hour prior to your departure time.

 

Luggage:
Small hand baggage can be taken on board. A larger baggage allowance is 2 bags per person with a maximum weight of 30kg per bag.

 

Oversized Sporting Equipment, including Bicycles, such as surfboards, golf clubs, and canoes, will be carried subject to an additional payment. Additional conditions apply to firearms.

""

The prices indicated are per accommodation (room, bed,etc.) or other services, for the number of people and the date(s) selected previously, unless otherwise specified. If they are not included in the rate or specifically selected when the reservation is made, supplementary services (breakfast,half board,full board) are available as an option which can be paid at the accommodation directly.

 

Taxes are included in the price or indicated in the tax details. Some taxes may be payable on arrival at the accommodation (for example, tourist tax), depending on current local regulations.

 

Your total price is based on the rate for your booked number of guests. Extra prices may apply for additional guests , up to the maximum capacity.

 

Guests are required to show a photo identification and credit card upon check-in. Please note that all special requests are subject to availability and additional charges may apply.

 

Conditions of cancellation

 

If your plans change, you can cancel if the conditions of sale and cancellation allow you to do so

1. By firstly contacting the accommodation provider directly

2. By contacting the New Zealand Travel Team Ph : 0800 143669   E : info@newzealandtravelteam.com (allow additional 24 hours before cancellation cut off deadline)
